title: Love Island bosses 'sign up' star Jay Munro to new winter series
text:
Jay was meant to be on the show with Tommy Fury in 2019 @jaymunro26

We may have the Love Island blues but the rumour mill for the winter series has already started – and we can’t get enough.

TV star and Instagram sensation Jay Munro has allegedly been signed up for the winter edition which is due to start filming in January.

It also turns out that the hunk already knows a few of the former Islanders including Tommy Fury, Dom Lever and Josh Denzel.

Earlier this year, Jay landed a job on The Voice Australia and ITV bosses believe that he will be a big hit in the villa.

‘Jay will be the one all the girls will be chasing. Just Tommy Fury, he’s a sportsman, in good shape and has dreamy looks,’ a source told The Daily Star .

Advertisement

Advertisement

The footballer was said to be in the line-up for the 2019 summer series of the show which would have seen him star alongside boxer Tommy Fury.

Jay is friends with a few former islanders including Dom Lever and Josh Denzel @jaymunro26

Yet bosses decided to save him for the upcoming winter series in early 2020.

This isn’t unusual for the Love Island bosses; producers had hoped to line up Amber Gill for the 2018 series but she didn’t star on the show until 2019.

Jay isn’t the first name to emerge for the new show, as in September model and fitness instructor Ellis Iyayi was the first name to be rumoured.

A show insider told The Sun: ‘Ellis is over the moon about it – he’s had to be sworn to secrecy about it but he’s been in to meet producers a few times and they love him – he can’t wait to get in the villa. ‘Ellis is exactly what the show is looking for and he ticks all the boxes – he will make great television.’

The new winter series will be slightly different as the Love Island villa will be based in Cape Town, South Africa instead of the usual Mallorca.

Filming is expected to begin for the steamiest show on TV in January.

The Love Island returns to ITV2 in 2020.
